definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The extremity of national identity evolves easily into national separatism .
sentences.chinese: 民族認同的極端化極容易演化成民族分離主義。

sentences.english: Separatism de-emphasizes the developer's responsibility for software quality.
sentences.chinese: 這種分離主義不再強調開發人員對軟件質量的責任。

sentences.english: You don't have to sell me on Separatism, Dooku.
sentences.chinese: 你不必向我兜售分離主義思想，杜庫。

definition: to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
